page.title: 19LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The architecture in{Cookham}is very varied. The houses around the{Rise} are predominently small family homes, either detached or semi-detached although a few terraced properties,circa 1900,may be seen. The narrow{Pound}road has small terraced houses and public houses on one side with large detached, mainly white faced houses on the other. The mixture of building styles in { {Cookham Village}makes it picturesque and unique, and is a tourist attraction for both road and river users. The village is often used as a setting for television drama and advertisements. Half-timbered houses,a thatched cottage,terraced houses and stone buildings can be seen. The{ {School Lane}buildings still retain remnants of their brewing connections.
